content.description:
P1. 5.12a: stick clip the first bolt, then pop past the crux, and follow the black streak through the apex of the roof. The anchors are shared with

Methuselah

.
content.location:
This ascends the black streak right of

Methuselah

.

content.description: Wihizzle Dihizzle is the obvious white dihedral. It is a steep and pumpy line with multiple cruxes that will make you say its off the hizzle fo shizzle dizzle.
content.location: It is on the left side of the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
P1. 5.11b/c. Climb past three bolts (taking care in the run out to the third bolt). Pull the crux roof, and finish at anchors shared with

Low-Hanging Fruit

and

Old Man River

.
content.location: This is the third route from the right end of the wall.

content.description:
Sit start on the obvious low edge, then move up and slightly right on crimps to the undercling jug.  Pull the crux moves on awesome holds, moving up and left to the lip and tricky finish.  The stand start from the undercling goes at around V8 and is excellent as well.

Movement and rock quality are excellent...if it wasn't in a damp seepy cave, it would easily be 4-stars.
content.location: This boulder problem lies in a cave at the base of the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
This is the best warm-up route at the Twilight Cave.

Begin with a short corner feature and continue on blocky/juggy terrain. It ends at the same anchor as

No Crisis

.
content.location: This route is located right of center on the Twilight Wall.

content.description: Whos the master?! ShoNuff! This is another steep line out the center of the wall. Save some juice for the end or you might be kissing his Converses.
content.location: It is left of center on the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
This is a great extension to

No Crisis

.

Place a long sling on the

No Crisis

anchor, and launch into some very steep terrain. A tricky move getting right is followed by steep, long moves all the way to the awesomely exposed anchor.
content.location: This route is located right of center on the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
P1. 5.11d/12a. Clip the first bolt, then undercling up and right then up and over a bulge to a roof. Turn the roof directly past the bolt to anchors shared with

Antique Guns

.
content.location:
This is right of

The Wizened's

black streak.

content.description:
P1. 5.10c. Boulder over a low overhang, then climb an easy slab to cool moves over a bulge. The anchors shared with

Low-Hanging Fruit

.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the wall.

content.description:
This is the 2nd best warm-up at the Twilight Cave. Start with a tricky slab move to gain the steeper rock. Make a long reach right, then continue on a variety of holds and surprisingly pumpy movement to the chains.

It shares an anchor with

Sunset Years

.
content.location: This route is located right of center on the Twilight Wall.

content.description: The difficulties start right from the ground (stick-clip is a good call). Climb into a undercling/sidepull and continue on leaning edges to the 2nd bolt. From here fire into the "arete" feature and do a big move to a jug. Continue on jugs to a lip encounter with the "muffin" hold followed by a weird mantel sequence.
content.location: This route is on the far left-side of the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
P1. 5.11c. Stick clip the first bolt, then climb the orange streak past a crux at the second bolt. Continue up then right at the roof to anchors shared with

The Wizened

. Long slings help protect the rope at the anchors.
content.location:
Climb the orange streak left of

The Wizened

(the black streak).

content.description:
P1. 5.11b. Climb past the crux roof, but hang in there as the pump continues to build. Be careful getting to the anchors shared with

Old Man River

.
content.location: This is the second route from the right end of the wall.

content.description:
Climb up through a tricky initial roof to gain a series of left-trending edges to the 2nd bolt. From here, a big, low-percentage move right leads to some awesome slopers before a big-rest at bolt 4. From here, move left and do the top-half of

Muffin Top

.

The direct finish remains an open project for anyone that is interested.
content.location: The route is on the left side of the Twilight Wall.

content.description:
Do the same start as

Twilight

, but move up and left through small edges/pinches. Finish on the same topout of

Twilight

.
content.location: This boulder problem is located ina cave at the base of the Twilight Wall.

content.description: Start with an awesome, technical dihedral directly out of the Twilight Cave. When the corner becomes a ramp, move left to a series of tricky 5.12 climbing. Steep, pumpy climbing leads through the blocky roof. After you've fully recovered on the ledge, launch into a strange sequence to clip the chains at the very top of the wall.
content.location: This route is located in the center of the Twilight Wall and starts right out of the bouldering cave.

content.description:
P1. 5.10d. Start off a big block turning the roof and passing a crux at the second bolt. Climb carefully past some questionable flakes after the 4th bolt. The anchors are shared with

Render Unto Geezer

.
